title: Ghostly Ballroom Adventure #61
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Grand Ballroom
rooms.description: A magnificent ballroom frozen in time. Crystal chandeliers hang from the vaulted ceiling, their prisms catching moonlight from tall windows. The polished marble floor reflects ghostly figures waltzing to music only they can hear. Faded portraits line the walls, their subjects seeming to watch your every move. The air is cold and smells of old perfume and candle wax.

items.name: grand piano
items.description: An elegant black piano in the corner, its keys occasionally pressing down by invisible hands

items.name: yellowed sheet music
items.description: Old music sheets for a waltz composed in 1847
items.text: Waltz in E Minor - Composed for Lady Victoria's Grand Ball, 1847. Dedicated to Lord Edmund Ashworth, Master of Ashworth Manor. The combination to the music box is the year of this glorious event.

items.name: refreshment table
items.description: A long table covered with a dusty white cloth, set with crystal glasses and silver platters

items.name: ornate brass key
items.description: A brass key with the Ashworth family crest engraved on it

items.name: velvet lined chest
items.description: A decorative chest beneath the refreshment table with a brass lock

items.name: ball invitation
items.description: An elegant invitation on cream-colored paper
items.text: You are cordially invited to Lady Victoria's Grand Ball at Ashworth Manor. Date: October 31st, 1847. Dress: Formal attire required. The evening will feature dancing in the Grand Ballroom, viewing of portraits in the Portrait Gallery, and refreshments.

items.name: guest registry
items.description: A leather-bound book listing all attendees
items.text: Guest Registry - Lady Victoria's Ball: Lord Edmund Ashworth (host), Lady Victoria Ashworth, Duke of Somerset, Countess of Brighton, and fifty other distinguished guests. Tragically, this was the final ball before the great fire.

items.name: crystal chandelier
items.description: A massive chandelier that sways gently despite no breeze
items.text: The chandelier's crystals tinkle softly, creating an eerie melody. Engraved on its base: 'Installed by Lord Edmund Ashworth, 1847'

items.name: ghostly dancers
items.description: Translucent figures in period dress, eternally waltzing across the floor
items.text: The spectral dancers move in perfect synchronization, their faces frozen in expressions of joy from that fateful night. They seem unaware of your presence.

items.name: double doors to portrait gallery
items.description: Tall mahogany doors with brass handles, leading to the Portrait Gallery

rooms.name: Portrait Gallery
rooms.description: A long gallery lined with oil paintings of the Ashworth family through generations. Candelabras provide flickering light that makes the portraits seem alive. Display cases contain family heirlooms and documents. At the far end, a door leads to the Master's Study. The temperature drops noticeably as you move through the room.

items.name: portrait of Lord Edmund
items.description: A large portrait of a distinguished gentleman in formal attire
items.text: Lord Edmund Ashworth (1810-1847) - Master of Ashworth Manor. A generous host and beloved patriarch. His life was tragically cut short in the fire that consumed the manor on the night of the Grand Ball.

items.name: portrait of Lady Victoria
items.description: An elegant portrait of a beautiful woman in a blue gown
items.text: Lady Victoria Ashworth (1815-1847) - Beloved wife of Lord Edmund. Known for her charity and grace. She perished alongside her husband in the tragic fire.

items.name: family heirloom case
items.description: A glass case containing jewelry and personal items

items.name: silver locket
items.description: A tarnished silver locket with initials V.A. engraved on it
items.text: Inside the locket is a miniature portrait of Lord Edmund and a lock of hair. An inscription reads: 'Forever yours, Victoria'

items.name: document display case
items.description: A case containing historical documents and letters

items.name: manor deed
items.description: The official deed to Ashworth Manor
items.text: Deed of Ownership: Ashworth Manor, established 1820. Owner: Lord Edmund Ashworth. The manor features a Grand Ballroom, Portrait Gallery, Master's Study, and extensive grounds.

items.name: fire investigation report
items.description: An official report about the tragic fire
items.text: Investigation Report: The fire of October 31st, 1847 began in the Grand Ballroom during Lady Victoria's ball. All guests perished. The only room to survive intact was the Master's Study, which contained the manor's most valuable documents and Lord Edmund's personal safe.

items.name: memorial plaque
items.description: A brass plaque mounted on the wall
items.text: In Memory of Those Lost in the Fire of 1847. May their spirits find peace. The Master's Study remains as Lord Edmund left it, a testament to his legacy.

items.name: antique writing desk
items.description: A small desk with a locked drawer

items.name: iron study key
items.description: A heavy iron key labeled 'Master's Study'

items.name: master's study door
items.description: A reinforced oak door with iron fittings. Three questions are carved into a brass plate beside the lock.

password_questions.question: Who was the master of the manor?
password_questions.hint: Check the portraits and documents in the gallery

password_questions.question: Where did the fire begin?
password_questions.hint: The fire investigation report contains this information

password_questions.question: What room survived the fire?
password_questions.hint: Read the fire report and memorial plaque carefully

rooms.name: Master's Study
rooms.description: You've reached the Master's Study! Unlike the rest of the manor, this room is untouched by fire. Leather-bound books line the walls, and a massive desk sits before a window overlooking the gardens. A hidden door behind a bookshelf stands open, revealing a passage to safety. The ghostly presence feels peaceful here, as if the spirits approve of your escape.

items.name: mahogany desk
items.description: Lord Edmund's personal desk, still organized as he left it

items.name: Lord Edmund's final letter
items.description: A letter written on the day of the ball
items.text: My dearest Victoria, tonight we celebrate with friends and family. Whatever may come, know that my love for you is eternal. The secret passage behind the bookshelf will always provide escape should danger arise. - Your Edmund

items.name: floor to ceiling bookshelf
items.description: Shelves filled with leather-bound volumes on history, philosophy, and poetry

items.name: study window
items.description: A large window with a view of moonlit gardens
items.text: Through the window, you see the overgrown gardens and, beyond them, the path to freedom. The ghostly figures in the ballroom seem to be waving farewell.

items.name: wall safe
items.description: A safe built into the wall, now standing open and empty
items.text: The safe is empty except for a note: 'The true treasure was the love we shared. - E.A.'

rooms.win_message: You have escaped the Ghostly Ballroom! As you pass through the secret passage, you feel a gentle breeze and hear the faint sound of music and laughter fading behind you. The spirits of Lord Edmund and Lady Victoria have found peace, and you have solved the mysteries of Ashworth Manor. You emerge into the moonlit gardens, free at last. You win!
